titleStmt.title: Letter, Albert S. Marks in Nashville, Tenn., to J.G.M Ramsey in Knoxville, Tenn.1879 Nov. 13

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, Albert S. Marks in Nashville, Tenn., to J.G.M Ramsey in Knoxville, Tenn. 1879 Nov. 13
bibl.note: 1879 Nov. 13 Albert S. Marks, Governor of Tennessee, Nashville, Tenn., to J.G.M. Ramsey, Knoxville, Tenn. Appoints J.G.M. a delegate to the Yorktown Centennial celebration. Requests that he advise the writer as to whether he will accept the appointment.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

keywords.term: Yorktown (Va.) -- History -- Siege, 1781 -- Centennial celebrations, etc.
Ramsey, J. G. M. (James Gettys McGready), 1797-1884 -- Sources.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: It is my duty to appoint a delegate to represent the State of Tennessee in the Yorktown Centennial Celebration. If you will accept the appointment I will confer it upon you as it belongs to you as a matter of right. Advise me at you earliest convenience whether you you accept and oblige
